page.title: 16HOME LIFE
page.content: Some men work in the city or in oil related work. Only a small percentage of women work. The local families have been here for generations but in recent years, with the oil boom, there has been a steady flow of incomers. This situation will change with the fortunes of the oil industry. Most families shop for food in Alford and generally have regular shopping trips to the large stores in Aberdeen where they get a greater variety of goods usually at cheaper prices. Families in the isolated areas prepare themselves for winter by stocking up with food. It has been known for many shop shelves to be empty when storms are threatened. Holidays are not a regular event. Families associated with farming cannot leave animals or ignore haymaking and harvest time etc.
